means: 使生机勃勃( invigorate的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: The breeze was cool, brisk and invigorating.
sentence.Network_cn: 微风凉爽、清新，令人精神振奋。

sentence.Network_en: He found it invigorating to speak of the struggle for realism.
sentence.Network_cn: 一提到为现实主义奋斗,他感到浑身是劲.

sentence.Network_en: Such a cool invigorating sky and he had such a broad chest, yet he felt suffocated.
sentence.Network_cn: 这么凉爽的天,他的胸脯又是那么宽, 可是他觉到空气仿佛不够,胸中非常憋闷.

entry.tran: 令人充满生气的;令人精力充沛的;振奋精神的
entry.def: If you describe something as invigorating, you mean that it makes you feel more energetic.

example.ex: ...the bright Finnish sun and invigorating northern air.
example.tran: 明亮的芬兰的阳光与令人神清气爽的北方空气

auth_sentence.content: It's an invigorating debut, auspicious and appetite-whetting.
